Create a Dot Plot with Error Bars for Mystery Caller Studies with Logging and Error Handling

Source: R/figure_create_dot_plot.R
create_dot_plot.Rd

This function generates a dot plot for visualizing median values with error bars across different categories, such as insurance types. It includes error handling, meaningful variable names, and default behaviors for ease of use. Extensive logging tracks inputs, transformations, and outputs.

Usage

create_dot_plot(
  dataset,
  category_var,
  value_var = "median_days",
  lower_bound_var = "q1",
  upper_bound_var = "q3",
  dpi = 100,
  output_directory = "output",
  filename_prefix = "dot_plot",
  x_label = NULL,
  y_label = NULL,
  plot_title = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

dataset

A dataframe containing the data to be plotted. Must contain the variables specified in category_var, value_var, lower_bound_var, and upper_bound_var.

category_var

A string representing the column name for the categorical variable on the x-axis (e.g., insurance type).

value_var

A string representing the column name for the numeric variable on the y-axis (e.g., median days).

lower_bound_var

A string representing the column name for the lower bound of the error bars (e.g., first quartile).

upper_bound_var

A string representing the column name for the upper bound of the error bars (e.g., third quartile).

dpi

An integer specifying the resolution of the saved plot in dots per inch (DPI). Default is 100.

output_directory

A string representing the directory where the plot files will be saved. Default is "output".

filename_prefix

A string used as the prefix for the generated plot filenames. The filenames will have a timestamp appended for uniqueness.

x_label

A string specifying the label for the x-axis. Default is NULL (uses category_var).

y_label

A string specifying the label for the y-axis. Default is NULL (uses value_var).

plot_title

A string specifying the title of the plot. Default is NULL (no title).

verbose

A boolean indicating whether to print messages about the saved plot locations. Default is TRUE.

Value

This function displays the plot and saves it to the specified directory.

Examples

create_dot_plot(
  dataset = df_plot,
  category_var = "insurance",
  value_var = "median_days",
  lower_bound_var = "q1",
  upper_bound_var = "q3",
  dpi = 100,
  output_directory = "output/plots",
  filename_prefix = "insurance_vs_days",
  x_label = "Insurance",
  y_label = "Median Business Days",
  plot_title = "Comparison of Business Days by Insurance"
)
#> Error: 'is.data.frame' is not an exported object from 'namespace:assertthat'
